com.wordpress.ebc81.esc_pos_lib

Class ESC_POS_EPSON_ANDROID

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wordpress.ebc81.esc_pos_lib.ESC_POS_EPSON_ANDROID

  • public class ESC_POS_EPSON_ANDROID
extends java.lang.Object
    EPSON ESC/POS Commands Created by ebc on 05.01.2015. http://content.epson.de/fileadmin/content/files/RSD/downloads/escpos.pdf

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] barcode_height(byte dots)
      select bar code height Select the height of the bar code as n dots default dots = 162
      byte[] double_height_off()
      disable double height mode, select Font A ESC !
      byte[] double_height_on()
      Select double height mode Font A ESC !
      byte[] double_strike_off()
      double_strike_off ESC G n
      byte[] double_strike_on()
      double_strike_on ESC G n
      byte[] drawer_kick()
      Drawer Kick Drawer kick-out connector pin 2 ESC p m t1 t2
      byte[] emphasized_off()
      Turn emphasized mode off ESC E n
      byte[] emphasized_on()
      Turn emphasized mode on ESC E n
      byte[] feedpapercut_partial()
      feed paper and cut partial Feeds paper to ( cutting position + n x vertical motion unit ) and executes a partial cut ( one point left uncut )
      byte[] feedpapercut()
      feed paper and cut Feeds paper to ( cutting position + n x vertical motion unit ) and executes a full cut ( cuts the paper completely )
      byte[] init_printer()
      Initialize printer Clears the data in the print buffer and resets the printer modes to the modes that were in effect when the power was turned on.
      byte[] justification_center()
      justification_center ESC a n
      byte[] justification_left()
      justification_left ESC a n
      byte[] justification_right()
      justification_right ESC a n
      byte[] print_and_feed_lines(byte n)
      Print and feed n lines Prints the data in the print buffer and feeds n lines ESC d n
      byte[] print_and_reverse_feed_lines(byte n)
      Print and reverse feed n lines Prints the data in the print buffer and feeds n lines in the reserve direction ESC e n
      byte[] print_bar_code(byte barcode_typ, java.lang.String barcode2print)
      print bar code
      void print_line(java.lang.String line)
      print_line adds a LF command to the text

      Print and line feed LF

      select font hri Selects a font for the Human Readable Interpretation (HRI) characters when printing a barcode, using n as follows:
      byte[] select_fontA()
      Select Font A ESC M n
      byte[] select_fontB()
      Select Font B ESC M n
      byte[] select_fontC()

      select position_hri Selects the print position of Human Readable Interpretation (HRI) characters when printing a barcode, using n as follows:

      Set horizontal tab positions

      Turn underline mode on, set at 1-dot width ESC - n

      Turn underline mode on, set at 2-dot width ESC - n
      byte[] underline_off()
      Turn underline mode off ESC - n
      byte[] white_printing_off()
      white printing mode off Turn white/black reverse printing mode off GS B n

      white printing mode on Turn white/black reverse printing mode on GS B n

      • select_font_hri

        public byte[] select_font_hri(byte n)
        select font hri Selects a font for the Human Readable Interpretation (HRI) characters when printing a barcode, using n as follows:
        Parameters:
        n - Font 0, 48 Font A 1, 49 Font B
        Returns:
        bytes for this command

      • select_position_hri

        public byte[] select_position_hri(byte n)
        select position_hri Selects the print position of Human Readable Interpretation (HRI) characters when printing a barcode, using n as follows:
        Parameters:
        n - Print position 0, 48 Not printed 1, 49 Above the barcode 2, 50 Below the barcode 3, 51 Both above and below the barcode
        Returns:
        bytes for this command
